Comments_List: A methodological approach to modern Japanese history and an overview of most recent English literature in this field.
Deepened knowledge of modern Japanese history.
Read major works on modern Japanese history; learned about recent approaches to the big issues in the field.
Japanese history with various topics that I have not learned about

The reading list is very helpful and the assignments are well positioned for graduate students training. I hope some of the assignments could be accomplished cumulatively through the semester as opposed to be all designated towards the end.

Strengths: good selection of readings, Prof. Botsman good at leading discussion and came away always with some new insights and perspectives

Weaknesses: maybe would have been better to force the completion of assignments throughout the term instead of mostly at the end.
book presentations and in-class discussions are very helpful
High recommended for all historians on Japan or modern East Asia.
Yes, Professor Botsman makes this course fun and informative.
Yes, I think it is a useful course for getting a sense of the field.
Yes. The class is organized well and the content is useful
